workflow.name: Automate Odoo-triggered Redmine & GitLab account creation with Slack notifications
workflow.description:
## ðŸ“ŒWho is this for?
HR teams, IT Operations, and System Administrators managing employee onboarding at scale.
Itâ€™s perfect if you use Odoo 18 to trigger account requests and need Redmine + GitLab accounts created instantly and consistently.

## ðŸ“ŒThe Problem
Manual account creation creates bottlenecks:
- IT waits for HR notifications that often get missed or delayed.
- Duplicate accounts pile up when no one checks existing data first.
- Account creation timelines are inconsistent (sometimes correct, sometimes wrong).
- Zero visibility into what succeeded or failed.

## ðŸ“ŒWhat It Does
 Catches an employee account creation request from Odoo 18 â†’ queries employee data â†’ checks for existing accounts â†’ creates only the accounts that are missing â†’ notifies your team via Slack with the full status.
Here's the flow in detail:
1. **Webhook trigger from Odoo 18** - automatically fires when your HR team marks an employee as needing Redmine, GitLab, or both.
2. **Fetch employee data from Odoo 18** - pulls email and account type requirements.
3. **Deduplicate requests** - separates "needs both," "GitLab only," and "Redmine only" cases.
4. **Check for existing accounts** - queries Redmine and GitLab to avoid duplicate creation attempts.
5. **Create accounts** - uses Redmine and GitLab APIs to spin up accounts (only if they don't exist).
6. **Slack notification** - sends a summary showing what was created, skipped, or failed- including error details if something went wrong.

## ðŸ“ŒQuick Setup
- Generate a Webhook URL in n8n and configure Odoo 18 to call it during onboarding.
- Add Redmine admin API key and GitLab admin access token.
- Enable /users.json (Redmine) and /users (GitLab) endpoints.
- Configure Slack webhook for notifications.
- Test with sample data, then activate.

## ðŸ“ŒResults
- Zero duplicates - the system checks before creating.
- Full visibility - Slack reports every single attempt.
- Instant delivery - new hires get accounts on day one.
- Dramatically reduced IT workload.

## ðŸ“ŒTake It Further
- Auto-assign projects in Redmine/GitLab post-creation.
- Generate passwords or TOTP setup and email them to new hires.
- Log everything to Google Sheets, Notion, or a database.
- Handle multi-tenant setups if your Odoo manages multiple organizations.
- Add provisioning for Slack, Google Workspace, VPN, or other systems.

## ðŸ“ŒNeed help customizing?
Contact me for consulting and support:
[Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/company/bac-ha-software/posts/?feedView=all) / [Website](https://bachasoftware.com/bhsoft-contacts)

parameters.content: ## Create a new user in Gitlab

## Create a new user in Gitlab and Redmine 
- Then announce the results via Slack.

## Odoo 18 called a webhook
- The flow will be triggered when the Odoo system activates an action.

## Querying data in Odoo
- Check if there are any request records for creating Redmine or Gitlab accounts, or both?
- If there are no records, end the flow.
- If so, proceed to the next step for filtering.

## Find the record requesting both Redmine and Gitlab accounts on Odoo 18.
- If the data from Odoo includes both (Gitlab and Redmine account creation requests), then extract the "email" from the request record.
- If the data doesn't meet the requirements, branch to the subflow "Gitlab or Redmine account creation requests".

## Check on Redmine if that user's account already exists (by email).
- If you already have a Redmine account, proceed to the GitLab account creation flow.
- If you don't have an account yet, proceed to the GitLab account creation flow.

## Check on Gitlab if that user's account already exists (by email).
- If you already have an account, the flow will end and send a notification via Slack.
- If you don't have an account yet, proceed to the GitLab account creation flow and send a notification via Slack.
## Find the Redmine account request record on Odoo 18
## Create a new user and assign the user to a group in Redmine
## Create a new user and send reset password in Gitlab

# Automate Redmine & GitLab Account Creation for New Hires â€“ Effortless Onboarding.

This workflow is designed for HR teams, IT Operations, and System Administrators managing employee onboarding at scale.
Itâ€™s perfect if you use Odoo 18 to trigger account requests and need Redmine + GitLab accounts created instantly and consistently.

## ðŸ“ŒThe Problem
Manual account creation creates bottlenecks:
- IT waits for HR notifications that often get missed or delayed.
- Duplicate accounts pile up when no one checks existing data first.
- Account creation timelines are inconsistent (sometimes correct, sometimes wrong).
- Zero visibility into what succeeded or failed.

## ðŸ“ŒWhat It Does
 Catches an employee account creation request from Odoo 18 â†’ queries employee data â†’ checks for existing accounts â†’ creates only the accounts that are missing â†’ notifies your team via Slack with the full status.
Here's the flow in detail:
1. **Webhook trigger from Odoo 18** - automatically fires when your HR team marks an employee as needing Redmine, GitLab, or both.
2. **Fetch employee data from Odoo 18** - pulls email and account type requirements.
3. **Deduplicate requests** - separates "needs both," "GitLab only," and "Redmine only" cases.
4. **Check for existing accounts** - queries Redmine and GitLab to avoid duplicate creation attempts.
5. **Create accounts** - uses Redmine and GitLab APIs to spin up accounts (only if they don't exist).
6. **Slack notification** - sends a summary showing what was created, skipped, or failed- including error details if something went wrong.

## ðŸ“ŒQuick Setup
- Generate a Webhook URL in n8n and configure Odoo 18 to call it during onboarding.
- Add Redmine admin API key and GitLab admin access token.
- Enable /users.json (Redmine) and /users (GitLab) endpoints.
- Configure Slack webhook for notifications.
- Test with sample data, then activate.

## ðŸ“ŒResults
- Zero duplicates - the system checks before creating.
- Full visibility - Slack reports every single attempt.
- Instant delivery - new hires get accounts on day one.
- Dramatically reduced IT workload.

## ðŸ“ŒTake It Further
- Auto-assign projects in Redmine/GitLab post-creation.
- Generate passwords or TOTP setup and email them to new hires.
- Log everything to Google Sheets, Notion, or a database.
- Handle multi-tenant setups if your Odoo manages multiple organizations.
- Add provisioning for Slack, Google Workspace, VPN, or other systems.

## ðŸ“ŒNeed help customizing?
Contact me for consulting and support:
[Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/company/bac-ha-software/posts/?feedView=all) / [Website](https://bachasoftware.com/bhsoft-contacts)

user.name: BHSoft
user.bio: BHSoft is a Vietnam-based software development firm serving a global clientele. We combine top talent with the latest tech stacks to deliver exceptional SaaS, Mobile Apps, and specialized GIS/3D Mapping solutions. Committed to Agile practices and cloud optimization, we strive to be your trusted, long-term partner in digital innovation.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
